metadata.titel_preek: The Past As Preparation For The Future

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in human history and personal crisis to deliver those who are defeated and have returned to Him, establishing a memorial of past help to secure future confidence.

tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord thundered with great thunder
He will pick you up and he will calm you down
a personal Presence was behind this reliability
the God who brought us thus far
someone here... right at the raw end of your nerves
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver of God's action.

tekstueel_bewijs: Samuel told the people... how to defeat the enemy
dear souls, mothers and fathers... have prayed us back to God
helper.rol_van_god: God is the primary Subject, not just a Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help through providence and intercession.

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a bad habit but a crushing force (defeat, death, enemies) that requires divine 'thundering' to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of repentance and remembrance.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer/Israel
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Returning to the Lord / Setting up an Ebenezer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Human repentance (Secondary) is the condition mentioned for God's action (Primary), yet God is also described as the one who 'brings one down' to enable that return.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God's Faithfulness → Deliverance → The Defeated Soul

voorbeelden_god_subject: He makes such a soul to leap over walls
voorbeelden_mens_subject: you must put away strange gods

voorbeelden: yesterday's experience must have something to do with today
Samuel told the people... how to defeat the enemy
The Lord can bring you out
what he did yesterday, he can do today

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'Ability' (Pouvoir) in the face of human 'Inability'. It is a sermon of empowerment through divine agency.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God 'thundering'—a sovereign act that breaks the cycle of defeat.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; defeat is described as 'bitter', 'humiliating', and lasting 'twenty years'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While there are calls to action (return to the Lord), the engine of the sermon is God's past and future intervention. The hearer is positioned as one who is 'knocked down' and 'picked up' by God.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: If you do not know which way to turn, turn to Jesus

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord went into action and enemies were destroyed
Israel found that its strength was not sufficient

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: David and Samuel are used, but David's victory is explicitly attributed to God's help.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already leans theocentric by saying 'The same God who delivered me... will deliver me'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and hope; shifting focus from self-effort to God's track record.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic undertones: God must act for the situation to change.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The Einstein anecdote, the Israelite history, and the personal appeal all serve the single actantial goal: God's reliability.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'returning to God' as a human act and God 'bringing you down' to get hold of you.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord thundered... enemies were destroyed

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: Endowment of power to 'leap over walls'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; leads to 20 years of 'rancid bread'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative program. The 'Ebenezer' serves as a semiotic bridge between past grace and future hope.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it effectively counters the hearer's sense of inability.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Ensure the 'Vouloir' (Willingness to return) is also seen as a gift of grace.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of theocentric preaching that uses narrative to shift the hearer's gaze from their own failure to God's sovereign action.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the Einstein anecdote's pathos, Greimas shows it functions as a 'Sender' establishing the value of 'Reliability'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the stone; semiotics explains the stone as a 'Helper' in the hearer's current struggle.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'victory' is not the Subject's achievement but an Object granted by the Sender (God) to a passive Receiver.

appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'Be like Samuel' trap by focusing on the inscription on the stone rather than the character of the man.
